crtkTask.introText: Businesses in ${certainIndustriesLink} must report chemicals they have on-site to the Community Right to Know (CRTK) program. These chemicals are known as `Environmental Hazardous Substances (EHS)|environmental-hazardous-substances`. Reporting EHS helps keep New Jersey communities and businesses safe.
crtkTask.helperText: Enter your information exactly as it appears in your business tax registration documents.
crtkTask.errorTextNotFound: We couldn't find a business matching the information you provided. Please check your entries and try again, or contact the NJDEP for assistance.
crtkTask.errorTextFieldsRequired: Please fill out all required fields.
crtkTask.errorTextSearchFailed: We're having trouble searching for your business right now. Please try again later or contact support if the problem persists.
crtkTask.warningTitle: What if I don't complete this task?
crtkTask.warningText: Businesses that do not meet their CRTK requirements may receive thousands in fines and penalties.
crtkTask.federalInfoTitle: Important: Federal Requirements May Also Apply
crtkTask.federalInfoText: You may also be subject to federal Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act (EPCRA) reporting.
